item.title: AI Startup Anthropic Releases More Powerful Opus Model After Delay
item.description: Anthropic is set to roll out two new versions of its Claude artificial intelligence software, including a long-delayed update to its high-end Opus model, as the startup vies to stay ahead of a crowded market.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz

media:content.media:description: Anthropic is rolling out two new versions of its Claude artificial intelligence software.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds’ MNTN Shares Rise 60% After $187 Million IPO
item.description: Connected TV advertising platform MNTN Inc.’s shares climbed more than 60% after the company and some of its shareholders raised $187 million in an initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Ryan Reynolds

item.title: Startup Builder.ai Overestimated Sales by 300% to Creditors
item.description: When Builder.ai was seeking an emergency loan last year, the startup gave lenders a revenue forecast that proved to be four times its actual sales, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Yazhou Sun

media:content.media:description: Sachin Duggal

item.title: Lightspeed Revenue Tops $1 Billion, Fails to Sway Investors
item.description: Lightspeed Commerce Inc. was the worst performer on the S&P/TSX Composite Index Thursday after the point-of-sale operator reported a $556 million impairment charge amid economic uncertainty for small retailers.
item.dc:creator: Mathieu Dion

media:content.media:description: Dax Dasilva, founder and chairman of Lightspeed Commerce Inc., speaks during the COP15 UN Biodiversity Conference in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, on Monday, Dec. 12, 2022. The goal of COP15, the most important gathering on biodiversity in a decade, is to create a Paris Agreement-style roadmap to protect enough of the world's key ecosystems and slow climate change.

item.title: AT&T Buys Lumen’s Consumer Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
item.description: AT&T Inc. agreed to buy the consumer fiber operations of Lumen Technologies Inc. for $5.75 billion, expanding its fast broadband service in major cities like Denver and Las Vegas.
item.dc:creator: Michelle F Davis

media:content.media:description: An AT&T store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. AT&T Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Google Faces Antitrust Investigation Over Deal for AI-Fueled Chatbots
item.description: The Justice Department is probing whether Alphabet Inc.’s Google violated antitrust law with an agreement to use the artificial intelligence technology of a popular chatbot maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: The Google campus in Mountain View, California.

item.title: Oxford Properties Considers C$700 Million Loonie Bond Sale
item.description: Oxford Properties Group is readying a C$700 million bond sale maturing between four and seven years, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Chunzi Xu

media:content.media:description: Oxford Properties Group Inc. signage is displayed at Yorkdale mall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Thursday, Aug. 22, 2019. Statistics Canada (STCA) is scheduled to release consumer price index data on September 18.

item.title: OpenAI Announces Stargate Data Center Expansion in Abu Dhabi
item.description: OpenAI said it’s helping to develop a major data center in the United Arab Emirates, a big overseas expansion of its Stargate effort to build out AI infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: The Stargate construction site in Abilene.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Little Problem’ With Tim Cook Is a Big One for Apple
item.description: Apple Inc. has become a frequent target for attacks by President Donald Trump, a factor that has held the stock back as other big tech companies have rebounded over the past month.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: Customers queue inside an Apple store in Hong Kong.

item.title: Snowflake Gives Strong Outlook With Focus on New AI Tools
item.description: Snowflake Inc. gave a strong outlook for quarterly sales after launching a slew of new products over the last year.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Sridhar Ramaswamy, chief executive officer of Snowflake Computing Inc., at the Semafor World Economy Summit during the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and World Bank Spring meetings in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, April 25, 2025. The International Monetary Fund sharply lowered its forecasts for world growth for this year and next, warning the outlook could deteriorate further as US President Donald Trump's tariffs spark a global trade war.

item.title: Xiaomi Billionaire Touts SUV, Chinese Chip in Tech Showcase
item.description: Xiaomi Corp.’s billionaire founder outlined plans for its first SUV and top-end gadgets with self-developed mobile chips, showcasing ambitions to expand its technology portfolio and move past a much-publicized accident that cast doubt on its expertise.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: Lei Jun presents the Xring O1 chip in Beijing.

item.title: Trump’s R&D Funding Cuts Create Job Drought for Scientists
item.description: US job openings in research and development are plunging as the Trump administration ramps up funding cuts to government agencies, private contractors and universities, leaving some of the nation’s brightest minds scrambling to find work.
item.dc:creator: Augusta Saraiva, Michael Sasso

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump Photographer: Ting Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: MIT Will Enroll Fewer Grad Students as Trump Funding Cuts Strain Budget
item.description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology is enrolling fewer graduate students in its vaunted research programs and laying off employees as the Trump administration’s squeeze on universities muddles its financial outlook.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ryan

media:content.media:description: A person passes in front of the Great Dome on Killian Court at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, U.S., on Wednesday, June 2, 2021. In 2014, every undergraduate on the Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus had the chance to claim fractional ownership of a Bitcoin in an experiment referred to as the MIT Bitcoin Project.

item.title: AI Is Helping Executives Tackle the Dreaded Post-Vacation Inbox
item.description: The process of digging out after time away is getting its first real upgrade in years.
item.dc:creator: Jo Constantz

item.title: Musk’s Political Backpedal Leaves X Searching for Relevance
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner looks at Elon Musk’s stated desire to pull back from politics and what that may mean for his social network, X.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk, chief executive officer of Tesla Inc., speaks via video link at the Qatar Economic Forum (QEF) in Doha, Qatar, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. The fifth annual Qatar Economic Forum will gather government and business leaders in Doha to discuss what’s driving the global economy.

item.title: It’s Never Been Harder to Make It in Venture Capital
item.description: Funding for new VC firms has turned sharply downward, putting enormous pressure on newcomers.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Attendees work on a laptop computers during the Google I/O Annual Developers Conference in San Francisco, California, U.S., on Wednesday, June 25, 2014. Google Inc. has successfully wooed developers to build applications for smartphones and tablets based on its Android mobile software.

item.title: Middle East Funding Gaps Risk Delaying Startups’ IPO Ambitions
item.description: Startups in the Middle East are at risk of losing momentum and facing a longer path to public listings due to a lack of funding for firms trying to scale, according to Noor Sweid, founder of venture capital firm Global Ventures.
item.dc:creator: Christine Burke

media:content.media:description: Noor Sweid

item.title: BT Sees Broadband Losses Continuing as UK Competition Mounts
item.description: BT Group Plc said its earnings would be little changed this year as the UK telecommunications company predicted further broadband customer losses at Openreach.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: An EE and BT Group store in London.

item.title: Why Is Nvidia the King of AI Chips, and Can It Last?
item.description: Investors poured money into Nvidia Corp. and made it the world’s most valuable chipmaker, convinced that its lead in artificial intelligence computing would deliver riches. Attention has now shifted to whether AI itself will pay off for companies investing tens of billions of dollars in the vast data centers required to power it.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Nvidia H100

item.title: Tracking Down Hijacked Cars Helps Mint a New African Billionaire
item.description: Zak Calisto’s firm started out helping carjack victims recover their vehicles in South Africa two decades ago. It’s since expanded to an international track-and-trace giant with a New York listing — and made him Africa’s newest billionaire.
item.dc:creator: Prinesha Naidoo

media:content.media:description: Zak Calisto

item.title: Lenovo’s Shares Sink After PC, AI Hardware Rivals Squeeze Profit
item.description: Lenovo Group Ltd.’s shares fell their most in more than a month after reporting a worse-than-expected 64% drop in earnings, reflecting competitive pressures in the AI server and PC markets.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Jessica Sui

item.title: EU Puts €40 Million in First Foray Into Dedicated Defense Fund
item.description: The European Union’s investment vehicle is investing €40 million ($45 million) in a dedicated European defense fund, marking a first as the bloc seeks to improve its military capabilities.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan

media:content.media:description: The FEINDEF defense exhibition in Madrid. Photographer: Angel Garcia/Bloomberg

item.title: Qatar’s Wealth Fund Stays Active in China Despite US Concerns
item.description: Qatar’s $524 billion sovereign wealth fund is continuing to explore investment opportunities in China, even as geopolitical tensions push global investors to tread carefully.
item.dc:creator: Dinesh Nair, Anto Antony

media:content.media:description: The Lujiazui financial district in Shanghai.

item.title: Big Tech’s Model Endangers Economies, Says Varoufakis
25 African Startups to Watch in 2025
item.description: These solutions-oriented companies are focused on tackling regional challenges including health care, food storage and banking services.
item.dc:creator: Rivaldo Jantjies, Loni Prinsloo, Matthew Hill

item.title: AI-Generated Drugs to Reach Market by 2030, Says Insilico CEO
item.description: The first drugs conceived entirely by artificial intelligence will likely be commercially available around the end of the decade, according to the leader of an AI drug discovery startup.
item.dc:creator: Amber Tong

media:content.media:description: Alex Zhavoronkov in Suzhou, China, in 2023.

item.title: Crypto Crime Is the Future. Bank Heists Are History.
item.description: A rise in physical attacks on digital-asset holders says a lot about the trade-offs of a cashless society.
item.dc:creator: Lionel Laurent

media:content.media:description: Hard money.

item.title: Deadly Fungi Are Here, and They’re Spreading
item.description: Unlike “The Last of Us,” virulent fungal disease isn't a work of science fiction.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

media:content.media:description: Aspergillus fumigatus, the fungus responsible for severe infections such as aspergilloma.

item.title: OpenAI to Buy AI Device Startup From Apple Veteran Jony Ive in $6.5 Billion Deal
item.description: OpenAI will acquire the AI device startup co-founded by Apple Inc. veteran Jony Ive in a nearly $6.5 billion all-stock deal, joining forces with the legendary designer to make a push into hardware.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Jony Ive, left, is collaborating with OpenAI’s Sam Altman as part of a nearly $6.5 billion deal.

item.title: Computex 2025: Five Takeaways From Asia’s Biggest AI Tech Show
item.description: With much of the world’s attention on the AI race between the US and China, this week’s Computex conference served as a stark reminder of the central role that Taiwan continues to play in the global technology industry.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Jane Lanhee Lee, Annabelle Droulers, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg
